abstract: The $801 million sale comes as the London-based banking giant is shedding assets to focus on its more profitable operations.
snippet: The $801 million sale comes as the London-based banking giant is shedding assets to focus on its more profitable operations.
lead_paragraph: LONDON – HSBC, one of Europe’s biggest banks, said on Tuesday that it had agreed to sell its businesses in Costa Rica, El Salvador and Honduras for $801 million as part of its plan to focus on more profitable operations.
